text: Daniel Jacoby (August 14, 1933 – April 2, 2020) was a French lawyer and writer. He worked in intellectual property law and human rights. In 1970, he became a member of the International Federation for Human Rights (F.I.D.H.) and was the first cousin of Justice Robert Badinter. He became president between 1986 and 1995 and then became honorary president. He was knighted and as an officer of the French Legion of Honor. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2020 deaths Category:French human rights activists Category:French lawyers Category:French novelists Category:People from Val-de- Marne Category:Writers from Île-de-France
title: Daniel Jacoby
